title: NF: a prototype for ext special remote to store files in git/objects of a remote

labels.name: merge-if-ok
labels.description: OP considers this work done, and requests review/merge

body:
I have been blurbing about a remote which would (ab)use regular `.git/objects` and refs of a remote to store annexed context.  Nobody got excited, but I kept thinking about it because  often we annex context which is not necessarily "too large" to push it to github.  It might be that I need to share files which
- need to be encrypted if shared publicly;
- I know that later on might not need on every clone (thus shouldn't just go to git)
- are sizeable but not huge, but I know that committing them to git is a crime, but they would fit nicely to github
- I might need to make unavailable later on without rewriting entire history
- I might need to keep only the most recent version available publicly/from that repository

So, welcome the prototype (in bash) for now of `git-annex-remote-gitobjects` , so if you place it in your PATH (and make executable), you should be able to

    datalad install -gs https://github.com/yarikoptic/testds.git

and get 2 annexed files from that GitHub repo.

What I need to figure out is  how to RF CHECKPRESENT  to avoid fetching the object pointed by the ref.  If there is no way, I have ideas for a workaround... but hopefully git gurus (@kyleam and @joeyh) would tell me HOWTO

And then RF to store not a remote name but remoteurl as a parameter of the remote (or both?)
